title: Alexandre Lacazette backs Matteo Guendouzi to become one of the best midfielders on the planet
text:
Alexandre Lacazette believes his Arsenal team-mate Matteo Guendouzi can improve to be one of the best midfielders around due to his 'good ambition'.

Guendouzi was named the club's player of the month for September and was also nominated this week for the 2019 Golden Boy prize, awarded to the world's best player under the age of 21.

Now Laczette, who has a close bond with Gunedouzi along with Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, has spoken of his happiness at the accolades coming the way of the 20-year-old midfielder.

Despite a patchy start to the season for Arsenal, Matteo Guendouzi has impressed in midfield

Guendouzi has struck up a friendship with strikers Lacazette and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang

'He is like the younger brother [in the friendship group with me and Auba]!' Lacazette told Arsenal.com.

'We all really have a good relationship, we like to work and to laugh together so it's really good.

'I'm really happy for Matteo [for being named September Player of the Month], he played really well, he helped the team when we needed him, he is really improving each season so we are all really happy with his performances this month.

'We can see that every top midfielder in the world is like this [in terms of demanding the ball and being brave]. They all want to take the ball.

'Matteo has a good ambition, he wants to be one of the best players in his position so every day he is trying to be the best and this month he showed that he can be.'

Guendouzi played for France Under-21s against Azerbaijan last Thursday in a qualifying match

Gunedouzi was a relatively unknown quantity when he moved to Arsenal from Lorient in 2018.

But he has become a fans favourite at the Emirates, with his ball-winning attributes and hard work consistently praised by supporters and team-mates.

Arsenal return to action after the international break at Sheffield United on Monday night - the Gunners are currently in third place in the Premier League on 15 points.
